ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class is an excellent introduction into the grammar, structure, and themes behind literary Chinese. You familiarize yourself traditional mandarin and learn how to dissect ancient Chinese texts character by character. The texts themselves are always fascinating and engaging.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is one of my all time favorite courses I have taken at Yale. One of the great things about it is that Dr. Lin assigned us partners each week to work on the homework with. The class developed a great sense of camaraderie and friendship, but everyone was also very engaged in the course content and the stories we read, which were very entertaining and fun. The workload can be a lot, but overall it extremely rewarding in the end when you are able to look back and see how much you have learned.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES! Take this course. It is extremely challenging but fun, and you get to read a bunch of great stories. I had never expected to be so excited about literary Chinese, but it was one of my favorite courses ever.

extras.title: CHNS 170 01/CHNS 570 01 - Intro to Literary Chinese I
